summary: Email chain between attorneys and prosecutors regarding scheduling interviews for two alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein who claim assaults occurred around June 2004. The correspondence discusses travel arrangements and video conference logistics for interviews scheduled for August 26-27, 2019.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: New York attorney who will accompany one of the alleged victims during her interview with prosecutors.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Attorney involved in coordinating travel arrangements and scheduling for victim interviews with prosecutors.

persons.name: Teri
persons.context: Attorney representing alleged victims, communicating with prosecutors to schedule interviews and provide evidence.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Attorney copied on email correspondence regarding victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of criminal case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), accused of assaulting the clients mentioned in the correspondence.

connections.description: Working together as attorneys representing alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein, with Fudali accompanying one victim to interview.
Collaborating on coordinating travel arrangements and scheduling for victim interviews with prosecutors.
Both attorneys involved in the case, with Bloom copied on correspondence about victim reports.
Epstein is accused of assaulting Teri's clients around June 2004 according to the correspondence.

events.title: Scheduled victim interview
events.description: In-person interview scheduled with one alleged victim at prosecutors' office at 12 p.m.

events.title: Scheduled video conference interview
events.description: Video conference interview scheduled with second alleged victim located in Japan at 5 p.m. EST.

events.title: Alleged assaults
events.description: Two clients allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Initial discussion
events.description: Attorneys spoke with prosecutors regarding their clients who believe they were assaulted by Epstein.

keyFacts: Two alleged victims claim they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.
Interviews were scheduled for August 26-27, 2019, with one in-person in New York and one via video conference from Japan.
Attorneys provided photographs of the alleged victims from 2004 for prosecutors to compare with photos seized from Epstein's home.
The case referenced is U.S. v. Jeffrey Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), indicating ongoing federal prosecution.
Multiple attorneys including Lisa Bloom were involved in representing the alleged victims.
